src:
Box Office Korea Pekan Ini, 'Kim Ji-young, Born 1982'
05 Nov 2019, 17:45 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Meski mengundang kontroversi, film 'Kim Ji-young, Born 1982' tetap laris ditonton di Korea Selatan. (dok. Lotte Entertainment via KoBiz)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Film internasional menguasai pasar film Korea Selatan pada pekan terakhir Oktober dan awal November ini. 'Joker' dan 'Maleficent: Mistress of Evil' masih bertahan di lima besar box office Korea Selatan pekan ini.Sementara itu, berdasarkan Dewan Perfilman Korea (KOFIC), 'Kim Ji-young, Born 1982' menjadi satu-satunya film lokal yang masuk lima besar box office dan bertahan di posisi puncak. Berikut rangkuman box office Korea sejak 28 Oktober sampai 3 November 2019.5. JokerJoker kembali harus turun dua peringkat dibandingkan pekan lalu. Film ini telah meraih lebih dari US$900 juta setelah tayang di seluruh dunia sejak bulan Oktober. Film yang disutradarai Todd Phillips ini menceritakan kisah Arthur (Joaquin Phoenix), seorang komedian gagal yang menjadi penjahat psikopat akibat diskriminasi sosial dan pengaruh permasalahan mental yang ia derita.Joker yang adalah bagian dari semesta DC Comics ini merupakan produksi lepasan dari seri Batman. Setelah tayang perdana di Venice Film Festival, Joker mendapatkan sambutan hangat dari para penonton dan kritikus film. Mulai dari standing ovation selama delapan menit hingga ragam pujian dari kritikus.Pada pekan ini, Joker menjual lebih dari 204 ribu tiket di 660 layar atau setara dengan US$1,4 juta. Angka itu menambah total penjualan lebih dari 5,1 juta tiket.



4. Maleficent: Mistress of EvilMaleficent: Mistress of Evil juga harus turun dua peringkat dibanding pekan lalu. Film ini sekaligus membawa Angelina Jolie kembali ke layar lebar.Permasalahan Maleficent: Mistress of Evil terfokus pada Maleficent (Angelina Jolie) dan putri angkatnya Aurora (Elle Fanning) yang berseteru hingga mempertanyakan arti keluarga saat keduanya memiliki pandangan berbeda.Maleficent juga harus menghadapi masalah baru ketika ibu Pangeran Phillip, Ratu Ingrith ingin mengambil hak asuh Aurora dengan menjadikan sang putri sebagai istri dari anak lelakinya.Pada awal November, Maleficent: Mistress of Evil menjual lebih dari 239 ribu tiket di 768 layar atau setara dengan US$1,6 juta.



3. Weathering with YouWeathering with You merupakan animasi karya Makoto Shinkai, bercerita tentang karakter Hodaka yang keluar dari rumah dan kabur ke Tokyo. Dalam perjalanan, ia bertemu Hina, seorang gadis yang ternyata bisa mengubah cuaca.Karena kondisi dan kesulitan yang dihadapi, mereka berdua semakin dekat dan merasa saling melengkapi satu dengan yang lain. Namun banyak masalah yang harus Hodaka dan Hina hadapi di tengah kebahagiaan yang dirasakan.Weathering with You dipilih sebagai perwakilan Jepang dalam International Feature Film Awards atau dulu dikenal sebagai Best Foreign Language Film untuk Oscar 2020. Film ini juga menjadi animasi pertama yang diajukan Jepang ke Oscar sejak 'Princes Mononoke' yang dibuat Hayao Miyazaki pada 1998.Weathering with You telah menjual lebih dari 337 ribu tiket di 716 layar atau setara dengan US$2,3 juta sejak tayang 30 Oktober di Korea Selatan.



2. Terminator: Dark FateKisah robot dalam bentuk manusia, Carl yang diperankan Arnold Schwarzenegger masih berlanjut dalam film Terminator: Dark Fate. Cerita kali ini mengambil fokus pada Carl dan Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton) yang mengemban sebuah misi.Mereka harus melindungi seorang perempuan muda dari Terminator yang berasal dari masa depan. Jelas, misi itu tidak mudah karena mereka harus menghadapi manusia hybrid yang sangat kuat.Terminator: Dark Fate telah menjual lebih dari 1,3 juta tiket di 1.315 layar atau setara dengan US$9,8 juta sejak tayang 30 Oktober di Korea Selatan.



1. Kim Ji-young, Born 1982Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 berhasil bertahan di puncak box office Korea Selatan sejak pekan lalu. Film ini dibintangi Gong-yoo dan Jung Yu-mi setelah keduanya bermain dalam Train to Busan pada 2016.Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 menceritakan kisah kisah Kim Ji-young yang dipaksa keluar dari pekerjaannya karena hamil dan harus menjadi ibu rumah tangga sepenuhnya. Perlahan, ia kehilangan jati diri dan lambat laun, jadi 'gila'.Film ini diadaptasi dari novel karya Cho Nam-ju dengan judul serupa. Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 sempat memicu kontroversi karena dianggap menjadi simbol perjuangan perempuan di tengah patriarki Korea Selatan.Namun kisah kontroversial tersebut telah mencatat satu juta penonton hanya dalam beberapa hari tayang. Sejak tayang pada 23 Oktober, Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 telah berhasil menjual lebih dari 2,4 juta tiket di 1,438 layar atau setara dengan US$17 juta.Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 direncanakan tayang di Indonesia pada 20 November.




(chri/rea)
text:
Korean Box Office This Week, 'Kim Ji-young, Born 1982'
05 Nov 2019, 17:45 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Despite inviting controversy, the film 'Kim Ji-young, Born 1982' remains in demand to watch in South Korea. (doc. Lotte Entertainment via KoBiz)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - International films dominated the South Korean film market in the last week of October and early November. 'Joker' and 'Maleficent: Mistress of Evil' still survive in the top five South Korean box office this week. Meanwhile, according to the Korean Film Council (KOFIC), 'Kim Ji-young, Born 1982' is the only local film that entered the top five box office and stayed in the top position. The following is a summary of the Korean box office from 28 October to 3 November 2019.5. JokerJoker must go back two ranks compared to last week. The film has won more than US $ 900 million after airing worldwide since October. The film directed by Todd Phillips tells the story of Arthur (Joaquin Phoenix), a failed comedian who became a psychopathic criminal due to social discrimination and the influence of mental problems he suffered. After premiering at the Venice Film Festival, the Joker received a warm welcome from the audience and film critics. Starting from a standing ovation for eight minutes to a variety of praise from critics. On this week, Joker sold more than 204 thousand tickets on 660 screens, equivalent to US $ 1.4 million. That number adds to the total sales of more than 5.1 million tickets.



4. Maleficent: Mistress of EvilMaleficent: Mistress of Evil also has to go down two ranks compared to last week. This film also brought Angelina Jolie back to the big screen. Maleficent Problems: Mistress of Evil focused on Maleficent (Angelina Jolie) and her adopted daughter Aurora (Elle Fanning) who clashed to question the meaning of family when the two had different views. when Prince Phillip's mother, Queen Ingrith wanted to take custody of Aurora by making the princess the wife of her son. In early November, Maleficent: Mistress of Evil sold more than 239 thousand tickets on 768 screens, equivalent to US $ 1.6 million.



3. Weathering with YouWeathering with You is an animation by Makoto Shinkai, which tells the story of the Hodaka character who goes out of the house and runs off to Tokyo. On the way, he meets Hina, a girl who turns out to be able to change the weather. Because of the conditions and difficulties encountered, they both get closer and feel complementary to one another. However, there are many problems that Hodaka and Hina have to face in the midst of their happiness .athering with You was chosen as Japan's representative at the International Feature Film Awards or formerly known as the Best Foreign Language Film for Oscar 2020. This film also became the first animation submitted by Japan to the Oscars since the 'Princes Mononoke' made by Hayao Miyazaki in 1998.Weathering with You has sold more than 337 thousand tickets on 716 screens, equivalent to US $ 2.3 million since airing October 30 in South Korea.



2. Terminator: Dark Fate The story of a robot in human form, Carl, played by Arnold Schwarzenegger still continues in the movie Terminator: Dark Fate. The story this time takes focus on Carl and Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton) who carry out a mission. They must protect a young woman from the Terminator who comes from the future. Obviously, the mission was not easy because they had to face a very strong hybrid human. Reflector: Dark Fate has sold more than 1.3 million tickets on 1,315 screens or the equivalent of US $ 9.8 million since airing October 30 in South Korea.



1. Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 managed to stay at the top of the South Korean box office since last week. The film stars Gong-yoo and Jung Yu-mi after both of them play in Train to Busan in 2016. Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 tells the story of Kim Ji-young who was forced out of her job because she was pregnant and had to become a full-time housewife. Slowly, he lost his identity and gradually, so 'crazy'. The film was adapted from a novel by Cho Nam-ju with a similar title. Kim Ji-young, Born 1982, had sparked controversy because it was considered to be a symbol of the struggle of women in the midst of the patriarchy of South Korea. Since it aired on October 23, Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 has managed to sell more than 2.4 million tickets on 1,438 screens or the equivalent of US $ 17 million. Kim Ji-young, Born 1982 is planned to air in Indonesia on November 20.




(chri / rea)
